item.title: [PI] The playerSave class
item.dc:creator: @Atreyu1993 Atreyu1993
item.description:
@Atreyu1993 wrote:

I was wondering how you would go about adding a String in the PlayerSave, i looked into it somewhat and added the following as an example :

					} else if (token.equals("realName")) {
						p.realName = token2;
			characterfile.write("realName = ", 0, 11);
			characterfile.write(p.realName, 0, p.realName.length());
			characterfile.newLine();

I declared the realName String in the player class.

That code gives the following error:

I would assume that is not the proper way to save String’s using the playerSave class, does anybody know the proper way, or can tell me what i did wrong?

Read full topic
